info.name: Corticospinal tract, anterior
info.description: The anterior corticospinal tract or ventral corticospinal tract is a small and highly variable portion of the corticospinal tract that does not decussate at the caudal aspect of the medulla in the pyramidal decussation. As a result, the tract travels in the anterior funiculus of the spinal cord until the fibers decussate in the ventral white commissure at the level of their termination in the contralateral ventral horn.  The tract extends only to the cervical and upper thoracic segments of the spinal cord.
